name: Divider

props.name: lineColor
props.description: Explicit colour. By default, Divider uses the surface text colour via CSS var (falls back to theme.colors.text).

props.name: thickness
props.description: Line thickness. Numbers scale the base divider stroke (1 = base, 2 = double) via calc(var(--valet-divider-stroke) * n); strings pass through (e.g., "2px").

props.name: length
props.description: Length along the main axis. Numbers → px; strings pass through (e.g., "50%", "12rem").

props.name: pad
props.description: Outer spacing envelope. Numbers map via theme.spacing(n); strings pass through. Obeys compact.

props.name: compact
props.description: Zero out padding for compact density.

bestPractices: Use to separate related groups; avoid overuse that creates visual noise.
Prefer semantic spacing first; add dividers only when separation isn’t clear.
Match thickness and colour to theme density; avoid heavy borders in content‑dense areas.
Respect alignment—span appropriate containers and avoid awkward trims.
Don’t communicate state with dividers; use colour/tokens in the relevant component instead.
